concise_definition: n. (专有名词) 康拉德（人名)

definitions.explanation_en: A proper noun, typically used as a given name or surname, most notably associated with Joseph Conrad, the Polish-British novelist known for works such as Heart of Darkness and Lord Jim.
definitions.explanation_cn: 专有名词，通常用作人名或姓氏，最著名的是波兰裔英国小说家约瑟夫·康拉德（Joseph Conrad），其代表作包括《黑暗之心》和《吉姆老爷》。
definitions.example_en: Joseph Conrad's literary style profoundly influenced modernist fiction.
definitions.example_cn: 约瑟夫·康拉德的文学风格对现代主义小说产生了深远影响。
